page.title: 02Ennerdale _ History
page.content: Ennerdale Forest was formerly part of the Ancient Royal Forest of Copeland which was used for hunting and progressively cleared through the ages .By Elizabethan times much of the forest had been cut to provide charcoal to smelt ore from the local iron mines.There is evidence of the charcoal burners in Side Wood.Here there are clearings surrounded by large stones.The later introduction of sheep prevented the regeneration of the forest and for centuries sheep grazing was the main land use.In 1925 the Forestry Commission began aquiring land in the area.Planting began in 1926 to help create a reserve of timber to meet the nations need and to provide much needed jobs for the unemployed miners of nearby Cleater Moor.
